docs.snippet: It’s not clear what kind of memorializing and monetizing of his final season Jeter will approve, but the sports collectibles business is well prepared to cash in....
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s not clear what kind of memorializing and monetizing of his final season Jeter will approve, but the sports collectibles business is well prepared to cash in.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir Sports Business column notes that farewell tour for New York Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter, who is retiring after 2014 season, is coming; says breadth and tenor of season-long 'Adieu to Derek' will be largely up to Jeter, his agent and his family, but sports collectibles business is well prepared to cash in.

headline.main: Let the Marketing of Derek Jeter’s Farewell Begin

docs.snippet: Although he expressed patience with the Mets’ payroll, Wright, 31, has made the playoffs only once in 10 seasons with the team....
docs.lead_paragraph: Although he expressed patience with the Mets’ payroll, Wright, 31, has made the playoffs only once in 10 seasons with the team.
docs.abstract: New York Mets third baseman David Wright has seven years left on contract extension he signed in 2012; having seen team make playoffs only once in his 10 seasons with Mets, he knows time is running out on hopes for team's payroll to increase enough to bring in top-end free agents and hopes of a championship.

docs.lead_paragraph: Derek Jeter said on Thursday that he would answer questions at a news conference next week about his decision to retire.
docs.abstract: Derek Jeter tells crowd of autograph seekers that he will answer questions at a news conference about his decision to retire after his 20th season with New York Yankees but that he feels good about his decision and plans to soak in every aspect of his last season.
